cluster_relations.rel_desc: Ecological connections and processes are components that make up the natural world.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject is a constituent or component of the object, which is a larger whole or system.

qualifiers.SpatialQualifier: within ecosystems of the natural world

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Communities, both large and small, are implicitly made up of people around the world.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject, typically a group or community, consists of or includes the members represented by the object.
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Story and Legend Audiences (including Cautionary Narratives)

qualifiers.UncertaintyQualifier: inferred membership based on common-sense semantics

remarks: Composition relation inferred from sociological meaning of 'communities', not literally spelled out.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The escaped criminal has a hook instead of a hand.

cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject entity is a physical component or substructure of the object entity.

qualifiers.SpatialQualifier: on the exterior of the car door
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Function: mechanism to open the car door

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The collective imagination is a component or attribute of society.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject entity is a component, aspect, or subset of the object entity.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Psychological and Cultural Constructs of Urban Legends

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject entity is a component, aspect, or subset of the object entity, which represents a larger whole or system.
args.justification: This relation is a standard part–whole (subset) relation with the subject as the component and the object as the larger whole, matching the existing use of 'part_of' in other instances. Normalizing from 'is_part_of' to 'part_of' removes an unnecessary variant and keeps predicate naming consistent while preserving directionality.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject entity is a component, aspect, or subset of the object entity, which represents a larger whole or system.
executed_decisions.justification: This relation is a standard part–whole (subset) relation with the subject as the component and the object as the larger whole, matching the existing use of 'part_of' in other instances. Normalizing from 'is_part_of' to 'part_of' removes an unnecessary variant and keeps predicate naming consistent while preserving directionality.
